entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 132,083Chapters: 25/31Kudos: 973

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team looks right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

entry.title: Today Will Be Different (It Has To Be)
entry.summary:
Author: RoxyRose1864

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,954Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 3

Summary: October 8th, 2018Dear Diary,Today will be different, it has to be. I will smile and it will be believable. My smile will say ‘I'm fine, thank you. Yes, I feel much better.' I will no longer be the sad little boy who lost his parents and his girlfriend. I will start fresh, be someone new. It's the only way I'll make it through.ORThe OTHER 9-1-1 TVD AU that nobody asked for.

entry.title: Wes Begins
entry.summary:
Author: BuddiefanRPNJ

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 73,899Chapters: 6/11Kudos: 80

Summary: Over the past few months, Wesley Cross and his husband, Cole, have become integral parts of the lives of Buck, Eddie, and the rest of the 118. After uncovering that the bridge collapse was no accident, the 118 and their allies are on high alert, knowing that it's only a matter of time before disaster strikes again. Wes is consumed by guilt, convinced that his very presence is endangering his friends. But the time has come to reveal the truth to his new family, for the keys to defeating their new enemy may be entangled with his tragic past. As Wes plunges into the depths of his most traumatic memories, the shocking revelations might just reveal surprising connections between him and other members of the 118.

entry.title: there it is again, sitting on my chest (makes it hard to catch my breath)
entry.summary:
Author: Elgney

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,152Chapters: 2/4Kudos: 263

Summary: “I just—I don’t want you to be alone,” said Eddie, softly, like an admission.Join the fucking club, Buck thought. It was funny, but none of his laughs were coming out right tonight. “I am alone, Eddie.”“Buck, I—”“She wants my kidney.” There it went; Buck never could keep anything inside. Could never keep the feelings contained, could never stop them from spilling out over the people nearest him. “That’s what fucking happened, okay? My dad needs a kidney donor and they remembered why they bothered having me in the first place. Is that what you wanted to hear? That my parents finally found a use for me after all these years?”

entry.title: Ghost in the fire
entry.summary:
Author: MustacheEddie

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,240Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 1

Summary: In a gripping tale set in the *9-1-1* universe, the story follows Buck and Eddie as they navigate their roles at the firehouse, building on their close friendships and shared experiences. However, when an unexpected tragedy strikes, the team is forced to cope with the aftermath, and their lives are forever altered. As presences lingers in ways they cannot explain, the narrative delves into how the characters grapple with grief, loss, and the emotional journey of healing. The story offers a poignant exploration of relationships, the bonds formed in times of crisis, and the enduring impact of those we lose.

entry.title: Like You Were My Closest Friend
entry.summary:
Author: isthatacatsherlock

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,205Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 144

Summary: Helena did not know that Buck took care of him after he got shot. She certainly didn’t know that he stayed with Chris until he came home from the hospital. She didn’t know what a natural move it was for Buck to take over his lease because he already fit so nicely into his life. She wouldn’t always say anything, but when she did they were just little comments she could tell had some deeper resentment under them.“Sounds like he helped with Chris a lot,” she said one morning over coffee.“It wasn’t like a big deal or anything,” said Chris. Helena was looking at Eddie when she responded “mhm.”It would be impossible to get her to understand, but he needed him here. In theory the choice to move had been easy. Not a choice at all – Chris, above all else. That was true. Buck didn’t just matter, though. He was entwined.

entry.title: Champagne Problems
entry.summary:
Author: ash_ptv

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,496Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 12

Summary: Following the events of Eddie leaving for Texas and Buck's one night stand with Tommy, Buck has to face the reality of not only living in LA without Eddie but living in what was Eddie's old house. Maddie has already encouraged Buck to learn to be alone and stay away from relationships knowing how her little brother can get when he is upset and not thinking clearly. Buck seems to be taking Eddie's advice to "not make everything about him" to heart and is avoiding sharing details of his personal life and struggle with his crew. Will this be a chance for Buck to get back together with his most recent ex? Or will Buck look more into the idea that his feelings for Eddie aren't as platonic as he may think as Tommy and Maddie have suggested.Eddie is finally back with Chris and he has a lot of time while job searching to focus on how he feels now that Buck isn't 20 minutes away anymore. Is Chris really satisfied in his life with Texas now that it is not just a place he could run from his dad? Why does Chris feel like part of his family is still in California, and not the family he was running from? How will Eddie feel now that Buck seems to be talking with Tommy again?

entry.title: how lucky are we to have so much to lose?
entry.summary:
Author: rebecca_welton

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,033Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 223

Summary: It happens in a blink of an eye.One moment, his GPS is telling him to change lanes so that he can take the next exit in a quarter of a mile, only twenty minutes away from Eddie’s.The next, the trailer of the eighteen wheeler beside him is suddenly swinging into his lane. He’s never seen a truck jackknife in person. Before he can fully process what’s happening, he hears the scrape of metal against metal as his truck is slammed into the median, and the cab of the eighteen wheeler collides with the front of his car as it folds inwards.

entry.title: Amazingly Perfect Match
entry.summary:
Author: Jackaroony

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,478Chapters: 5/12Kudos: 13

Summary: Evan “Buck” Buckley MAR. 4th 11:03:13 AM “Do I really have to talk right now? Fine, Maddie, if you are watching, I’m sorry if you saw what happened yesterday; feel free not to consider me a brother anymore. As for my friends at 118, please tell me you didn’t see that. I begged you not to watch! By the way, you guys see all of the footage, right? Could you tell me who left the water on my nightstand? You can’t or won’t because I can see in your eyes that you know who I should thank to...” Edmundo “Eddie” Diaz MAR. 4th 11:13:41 AM “How could I leave him alone? I tried to put him in his bed, but he kept pushing me away, calling me Bobby and Cap. In the end, I stopped trying and let him sleep on the floor. If not for the smell of alcohol, he would remind me of my son when he refuses to go to sleep. Please, don’t tell him that I left the glass of water on his nightstand. I know that he doesn’t like me for who knows what reason, but it felt wrong to leave him when the girl he spent the night with did. They what?!”-The relationship between Buck and Eddie didn't start Amazingly, but in the end, they realized that they were a Perfect Match.
